reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: The project maps out the opportunities for impact investments for companies in two target markets Kenya and South Africa which based on research are the main hubs of impact investors in southern and eastern Africa. The main objective is to identify in both countries companies with whom Invivace will establish a long-term cooperation agreement for executing funding processes. Secondary goals are to carry out a pre-feasibility assessment regarding the feasibility of the business idea and alternative business models and draw a business plan together with partner companies.The project outcome will be a partner network of Invivace in target markets. The networks' operations will be further focused on selected sectors and funding instruments based on the pre-feasi bility study and the use service design to match the service with the demand from companies based on the objectives of the business plan. Business development will continue intensively after this four-month pre-assessment project. The first goal is to find pilot clients potentially already during this project (several negotiations ongoing).The most important long-term impact of the project is the increase of impact investments in target countries. Investments will be absorbed by local companies that by defi nition produce products or services that have intentional positive development impacts. Other development impacts include the increase of turnover of partner companies increased tax income of target countries increasing number of jobs in partner companies and continuous education of partner companies. Considerable indirect positive development impacts will be brought in as only those companies who include intentional development impact in their strategies are accepted as clients.
